definition: to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss

sentences.english: Supervisory issues and supervisory strategies may affect supervisee 's session impact.
sentences.chinese: 督导议题与督导策略可能影响受督者之晤谈感受。

sentences.english: Mrs Penniman had no appetite whatever for conversation with Mrs Montgomery…
sentences.chinese: 佩尼曼太太根本没有那种雅兴去跟蒙哥马利太太晤谈。

sentences.english: I guess they're trying to set up an appointment for me.
sentences.chinese: 我猜他们正设法给我安排晤谈。

sentences.english: He had an appointment with his lawyer set for Monday.
sentences.chinese: 他预约在星期一同他的律师晤谈。

definition: to meet (in person)/to meet with sb
to have a discussion in a group/to have a chat with sb
to communicate by means of written notes (instead of speaking)/to publish one's opinion (e.g. as part of a scholarly dialogue)/(in book titles) essays/sketches
lit. knees pressed close/intimate/seated side by side/in close contact
your visit (honorific)/you honor me with your visit
lit. to open a room/fig. to settle in a quiet room/behind closed doors
to meet with (sb who is paying a visit)/CL:次[ci4]
to take tea and chat/a small-scale informal gathering with tea and snacks
